basics.name: Aidan Jalali
basics.label: Web/UI Designer & Front-end Developer
basics.summary: Aidan is a web designer and developer from the sunny climes of Manchester, living, working and breathing in London. Having finished his BA in Creative Digital Media at Teesside University, he went on to snatch a job at EA games creating all kinds of colourful things - namely, Flash adverts and marketing pages. Then, following a brief stint working for a web design agency in Bournemouth, he joined the wonderful Everlution Software where he rediscovered his love for front-end development, and is now jobless after deciding he wanted to 'do his own thing for a while'. He has since designed and developed his first mobile app, Point Me There, and is well on his way to making his first mobile game. He also loves talking in third person, because it makes him feel a little bit like Yoda.

location.address: Flat 32 Bridge View Court, 19 Grange Road

work.summary: Designing and developing apps and websites for myself and others; essentially taking a breather from the nine-to-five to work on my own projects for a while.
highlights: Created my first app, Point Me There
Redesigned my portfolio, my girlfriend's portfolio, and my friend's portfolio
Started learning AngularJS and Nodejs, and dabbled with Meteor

work.summary: Designing and building websites (from initial concept -> wireframe -> design -> front-end build), designing marketing material in a variety of formats (posters, fliers, online ads), with a focus on good user flow & user experience. The first port-of-call in our company for anything related to ui/ux design.
highlights: Designed the logo, website and all stationery for Everlution Software
Single-handedly won a contract for a large bank to provide UI/UX advice for their global website overhaul
Saw over 10 large projects from start to finish, including wireframing, initial designs and front-end development and styling

work.summary: Designed websites for clients as well as design proposals for internal projects.

Creating and modifying banners in Flash, advising external agencies on user flow and interface design for outsourced adverts, and advising dev. team on Flash integration for rich media in marketing pages. Bespoke designs for marketing emails and landing pages using Photoshop and Illustrator, as well as frequent modifications to existing creatives.
highlights: Developed new designs for EU Pogo's 'download games' pages (one of the key revenue streams)
Applying user interaction knowledge and marketing advice to develop the best user flow for optimum click-through rates/conversions for premium content

interests.name: Wasting away untold hours browsing Reddit
The usual going out, socialising, etc.

references.name: Peter Brown, Web Developer
references.reference: Aidan is an amazingly creative and gifted designer with an exceptional understanding of marketing requirements and user experience. He has consistently delivered top notch design and is always ready to go above and beyond to get the job done right. His passion for his job is infectious and his can do attitude and talent under pressure and tight deadlines is inspirational. Aidan brings something special to everything he works on, he is a joy to work with and a brilliant guy both in and out of the office. I cannot recommend Aidan highly enough.

references.name: Raf Keustermans, Director of Marketing
references.reference: Top Flash guy. We hired Aidan to work on European projects, but after our US colleagues discovered his work and talent, he also started working on global projects and campaigns. Aidan is an exceptional designer and a great colleague. Someone I'd like to work with again in the future.

references.name: Mark Young, Producer
references.reference: Aidan is a conscientious, skilled and versatile artist, who knows exactly how to put himself in the shoes of the customer/user. He has excellent attention to detail which makes a huge difference to the great work he produces. He's also an absolutely charming chap and it has been a pleasure to work with him.
